results.snippet: When the new Jerry Brown talks about mending the state, he sounds more like an I.M.F. official than a starry-eyed visionary.
results.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES -- I come here once a year, mostly to escape the farouche New England winters, but also to enjoy the impossibly diverting metropolis where I lived in the late 1970s. I was young, and California certainly felt young. I remember waking up one morning to hear the 40- year-old governor's voice booming from my radio, declaring his intention to ''protect the earth, serve the people, and explore the universe.'' I wasn't prepared for Gov. Jerry Brown. Seminary and law-school trained, Brown eschewed the trappings associated with administering America's most populous state, and one of the world's largest economies. He drove to work in a Plymouth sedan, and he didn't live in the governor's mansion. Stewart Brand, the creator of the Whole Earth Catalog, was a key adviser, and Linda Ronstadt, the Jenny Lind of the Golden West, was a storied girlfriend.

results.abstract: Another day of runway looks, another Scorecard at your service.
results.snippet: Another day of runway looks, another Scorecard at your service.
results.lead_paragraph: The fourth day of Paris fashion week was a day of swan songs planned - at Issey Miyake - and otherwise. So as Scorecard can tell you, the question of how well the white lab coated can carry on in the absence of their team leader was foremost on critics' minds. Accolades went to Lanvin's Alber Elbaz for creating from a new pruned down silhouette a powerful vision of fashion as tree of life.

results.abstract: John M Lounge, decorated Navy pilot and United States astronaut who was on the first shuttle flight after the 1986 Challenger disaster, dies at age 64.

headline.main: John M. Lounge, Who Flew on 3 Shuttle Missions, Dies at 64

results.snippet: A decorated pilot, he was on the first shuttle flight after the 1986 Challenger disaster.
results.lead_paragraph: A decorated pilot, he was on the first shuttle flight after the 1986 Challenger disaster.

results.abstract: John M Lounge, decorated Navy pilot and United States astronaut who was on the first shuttle flight after the 1986 Challenger disaster, dies at age 64. (M)Â¿
results.snippet: HOUSTON (AP) -- John M. Lounge, a crew member on three space shuttle missions, including the first after the Challenger disaster in 1986, died here on March 1. He was 64.     His death was confirmed by NASA. The cause was complications of liver...
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON (AP) -- John M. Lounge, a crew member on three space shuttle missions, including the first after the Challenger disaster in 1986, died here on March 1. He was 64. His death was confirmed by NASA. The cause was complications of liver cancer, according to The Houston Chronicle.

results.abstract: Shuttle Discovery braves fire of re-entry for the last time and glides back to Earth to close out space plane's 39th and final voyage, emotion-charged milestone marking beginning of the end for America's shuttle program; photos (M)

headline.main: A Bittersweet Finale for the Discovery

results.snippet: Back from the International Space Station, the crew spoke of the shuttle’s record: 39 flights covering nearly 150 million miles.
results.lead_paragraph: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Fla. -- The shuttle Discovery braved the hellish fire of re-entry for the last time Wednesday and glided back to Earth to close out the space plane's 39th and final voyage, an emotion-charged milestone marking the beginning of the end for America's shuttle program. Dropping through a partly cloudy sky, the commander, Steven W. Lindsey, and Col. Eric A. Boe of the Air Force guided Discovery through a sweeping left overhead turn, lined up on Runway 15 and floated to a picture-perfect touchdown at 11:57 a.m. Eastern time to wrap up an extended 13-day space station assembly mission.

results.snippet: A selected guide to events for, by and about children in New York.
results.lead_paragraph: 'SKELLIG' When the title character in ''Skellig'' is revealed to have wings, you may worry that you've wandered into the mawkish realm of ''Touched by an Angel'' and other vintage pop entertainment about heavenly messengers. But don't be fooled: if this unusual play has a presiding deity, it's Darwin. The script abounds in references to human evolution, to birds' descent from dinosaurs, to the wildness that civilization keeps only partly at bay. Oh, yes, and lots of quotations from William Blake.

results.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords, recovering from January shooting in Tucson, is likely to take a break from her rehabilitation in April to attend the launching of her husband Mark Kelly's space shuttle flight (M)

headline.main: Giffords Hopes to See Shuttle Launching

results.snippet: Gabrielle Giffords will take a break from rehabilitation to see off her astronaut husband during his shuttle launch.
results.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords is likely to take a break from her rehabilitation next month to see off her astronaut husband, Mark Kelly, personally during the launching of his shuttle, aides said Thursday. The Arizona congresswoman has not been seen in public since Jan. 8, when a gunman opened fire at an event she was holding for constituents outside a Tucson supermarket, killing six and wounding 13, including Ms. Giffords, who was shot in the brain.

results.abstract: Houston doctors say Rep Gabrielle Giffords is 'making leaps and bounds' in her neurological recovery after being shot in the head in Tucson; say her memory and cognitive levels are good, and that she is doing exceptionally well when it comes to showing her personality; photos (M)

headline.main: Giffords's Personality Is Shining Through In Recovery, Doctors Say

results.snippet: Representative Gabrielle Giffords has started to walk with assistance and her speech has improved to where she can tell doctors what she wants.
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords is ''making leaps and bounds'' in her neurological recovery after being shot in the head on Jan. 8 in Tucson, her doctors said Friday at a news conference. Her memory and cognitive level are good, her speech is improving and her personality has re-emerged, the doctors said. One said that when it came to showing her personality, Ms. Giffords was doing ''spectacularly well.''

results.snippet: Japan is a rich, high-tech nation but the earthquake and tsunami showed the limits of even the best preparation.
results.lead_paragraph: Here's the truly scary thing about the 8.9-magnitude earthquake off the coast of Honshu Island and its resulting tsunami: Japan is a country that is lauded for doing preparedness right. Japan is a rich, high-tech nation with much rough experience of seismic rumblings: those factors have led it to plan, and plan well, for disaster, with billions spent over the years on developing and deploying technologies to limit the damage from temblors and tsunamis.

results.snippet: He was a Soviet hero, a space pioneer (and a bit of a boozehound) who risked it all  to save a doomed comrade. An excerpt from ''Starman,'' a new biography on the rise and fall of Yuri Gagarin, featured in the pages of our upcoming Spring Men's...

byline.original: By JAMIE DORAN and PIERS BIZONY

results.lead_paragraph: He was a Soviet hero, a space pioneer (and a bit of a boozehound) who risked it all to save a doomed comrade. An excerpt from ''Starman,'' a new biography on the rise and fall of Yuri Gagarin, featured in the pages of our upcoming Spring Men's issue. April 12, 1961: 108 minutes

results.snippet: The disaster offers the chance to reform politics, rethink nuclear power and renew the country's cultural strength.
results.lead_paragraph: HIROSHIMA -- In an emergency press conference a day after an 8.9 magnitude earthquake and massive tsunami wrought devastation across northern Japan, Prime Minister Naoto Kan, looking exhausted but calm, told his countrymen that they faced together an unprecedented challenge, and that while the immediate priority would be saving lives, the nation could one day look back at this time as a moment that helped create a new Japan. It is difficult -- as the earth still trembles with aftershocks, the numbers of victims keep rising, and the risk of meltdown at the Fukushima nuclear power facilities becomes frighteningly plausible -- to draw any conclusive lessons from one of the greatest natural disasters ever to hit this country. It may take months, if not years, for survivors to regroup and start anew. But the prime minister was right in believing that this challenge may well extract unprecedented responses from Japan.

results.abstract: The inventive mixologist Alex Ott has worked on elixirs for astronauts and drinks to prevent hangovers.

headline.main: Space Age Drinks and Their Aftermath

results.snippet: The inventive mixologist Alex Ott has worked on elixirs for astronauts and drinks to prevent hangovers.
results.lead_paragraph: A few minutes after I sat down with Alex Ott at Keens, the primeval monument to New York mutton-choppery on West 36th Street, he opened a clear plastic briefcase with a NASA sticker on it, pulled out an atomizer, and sprayed something into my glass of water.

results.abstract: Soyuz spacecraft carrying two Russian astronauts and one American astronaut lands safely in Kazakhstan after end of mission at International Space Station (S)

headline.main: Russia: Space Station Crew Returns to Earth

results.snippet: A Soyuz spacecraft carrying two Russian astronauts and an American astronaut landed safely in Kazakhstan.
results.lead_paragraph: A Soyuz spacecraft carrying two Russian astronauts and an American astronaut landed safely in Kazakhstan after the end of their mission at the International Space Station. Plans to replace them, though, have been delayed because of technical problems.

results.snippet: A selected guide to events for, by and about children and teens.
results.lead_paragraph: THALIA KIDS' BOOK CLUB When Laurie Halse Anderson had the idea for a new young-adult novel several years ago, she had long discussions with her editor at Simon & Schuster about whether it was even appropriate for her to tell this story. That's unusual for a fiction author, but what she planned was unusual too: Ms. Anderson, who describes herself as ''a middle-class white woman,'' wanted to write from the point of view of a black slave girl.

results.snippet: A selected guide to events in New York for, by and about children.
results.lead_paragraph: 'TO THE MOON' Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, isn't likely to replace Cape Canaveral as a permanent launching site for spacecraft. But on Monday it will serve as a blastoff point for several extraterrestrial adventures. They make up ''To the Moon: Short Films About Space Travel,'' the latest program in the Brooklyn series Big Movies for Little Kids.

results.snippet: A book excerpt on March 13 about the life of Yuri Gagarin, a Soviet astronaut, misspelled the name of a luxury resort where he and other astronauts stayed in 1961. It is Tesseli, not Kisseli.
results.lead_paragraph: A book excerpt on March 13 about the life of Yuri Gagarin, a Soviet astronaut, misspelled the name of a luxury resort where he and other astronauts stayed in 1961. It is Tesseli, not Kisseli.

results.abstract: It remains unclear whether hospitalized Arizona Rep Gabrielle Giffords will recover from her injuries in time to run for Senate seat being vacated by Sen Jon Kyl, causing other prospective Democratic candidates to delay entrance into race; consensus is that Giffords campaign would be strong, reinforced by narrative of tragic gun attack that left her fighting for life; photos (M)

headline.main: A Senate Race in Arizona Waits To See if Giffords Emerges to Run

results.snippet: TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords is still in the hospital, but some of her most ardent backers are so enamored of the idea of her running for the Senate that they describe the inevitable campaign commercials: the deep-voiced narrator...

byline.original: By MARC LACEY; Ford Burkhart contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords is still in the hospital, but some of her most ardent backers are so enamored of the idea of her running for the Senate that they describe the inevitable campaign commercials: the deep-voiced narrator recounting what happened to her, the images of her wounded, then recovering and speaking into the camera alongside her astronaut husband to call on Arizonans to unite. These supporters say they do not want to get too far ahead of themselves, and make clear that Ms. Giffords, who was shot in the head, is still relearning basic tasks and might emerge from the hospital with neither the same political abilities nor aspirations that she had before. And publicly, her closest aides say the only thing they care about is her health.

headline.main: A Senate Race in Arizona Waits To See if Giffords Emerges to Run

results.snippet: Some aides suggest Representative Gabrielle Giffords might recover in time to seek a seat made available by Jon Kyl’s retirement.

byline.original: By MARC LACEY; Ford Burkhart contributed reporting

results.lead_paragraph: TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords is still in the hospital, but some of her most ardent backers are so enamored of the idea of her running for the Senate that they describe the inevitable campaign commercials: the deep-voiced narrator recounting what happened to her, the images of her wounded, then recovering and speaking into the camera alongside her astronaut husband to call on Arizonans to unite. These supporters say they do not want to get too far ahead of themselves, and make clear that Ms. Giffords, who was shot in the head, is still relearning basic tasks and might emerge from the hospital with neither the same political abilities nor aspirations that she had before. And publicly, her closest aides say the only thing they care about is her health.
